profile.description: Provides help frequently asked questions (FAQs) on different components. Each entry (under properties) consists of a 'title' for the information title and 'content' for the body of the message.

properties.title: What is a COPO Profile?
properties.content:
A COPO Profile is a collection of 'research objects' or components that form part of a research project or study. COPO currently provides templates for creating/describing the following components:
  • Datafiles
  • Samples
  • Submission
  • Publications
  • People
  • Annotations

properties.title: How do I create a Profile?
properties.content: Click on the  New Profile button at the top left corner of the page to create a new Profile.

properties.title: How many Profiles can I have in COPO?
properties.content: As many as possible! Since a Profile would typically represent a piece of research project, you can create as many Profiles as required in COPO to represent different projects (e.g., new grant, sub project within a large grant, PhD project)

properties.title: How do I create components in a Profile?
properties.content:
Each Profile created in COPO provides a means for defining a set of associated components (Datafiles, Samples, Publications, etc.). Instances of these components (e.g., uploading one or more datafiles, adding a person or collaborator) can be created in any order, although some of them may have some form of dependencies (e.g., Datafiles depending on Samples).

You can create a Profile component through one of two ways:

  1. Within the Profile page: only possible if the button is found on a component block.

  2. By navigating to the component page: use the button found on the component block to navigate to the component page. Follow the specific component creation instructions on the target page.
